in addition to figuring out what processes formed the tars, scientists also still don't know exactly what materials compose the various tar fields or why they see these large features on mars, but not on earth. over the next couple of years we should be seeing many more images from hirise that can gives us more information, for example, about the heights versus spacing and whether tars have more in common with dunes or the ripple fields found on earth, Matthew Balme said.
